medical_history.chief_complaint: Upper abdominal pain with nausea, vomiting, and diaphoresis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a 1.5-day history of symptoms that started suddenly yesterday afternoon while sitting. The pain is mostly centered in the RUQ, radiates outward, and has been progressing in intensity by the hour. It is intermittent and wavelike, with a sharp character and currently of considerable intensity. The patient has felt nausea since the onset and has vomited twice without relief before coming in. The vomit was yellow, non-bloody, and had a bad smell. The patient has not been able to pass stool since the onset of pain, though had one normal bowel movement yesterday morning. The patient has been able to pass flatus.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus controlled with diet, hypercholesterolemia, hypertension, depression (treated with sertraline, seroquel, and Zyprexa), and schizoaffective disorder (treated with seroquel, haloperidol, and ativan).
medical_history.social_history: Denies recent alcohol use, has a history of alcohol abuse issues, and denies drug and tobacco use.
